Course Description:
PREREQUISITE:ACG 3103 WITH C OR BETTER.
THIS COURSE INCLUDES SPECIFIC ACCOUNTING METHODS AND TECHNIQUES APPLICABLE TO GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major: STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO DISCUSS FUND ACCOUNTING TOPICS. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO RECORD GOVERNMENTAL ACCOUNTING TRANSACTIONS. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO DISCUSS TOPICS RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO DISCUSS AUDITING OF GOVERNMENTAL AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
